bullets.text: Senate advances deal to end shutdown; markets rally; FAA restricts private jets amid staffing; SNAP pause dents low-income spending.
Supreme Court takes mail-in ballot challenge, shaping 2026 election rules; declines to revisit same-sex marriage.
Trump proposes 50-year mortgages; analysts see limited savings, potential for higher interest costs and extended debt duration.
Winter electricity bills seen up >7%; lawmakers blame AI data centers; DOE expected to prioritize nuclear loans.
Syria’s president meets Trump at White House, signaling U.S.-Syria thaw and regional realignment efforts.
At COP30, Chinese low-cost clean tech reshapes climate politics, pressuring Western industries and accelerating global deployment.
CoreWeave revenue more than doubled, but weak guidance and data-center delays hit shares, spotlighting execution risks in AI infrastructure.
Visa, Mastercard settle with merchants; potential interchange changes could compress credit-card rewards and issuer margins.
Treasury’s $125B auctions loom as Fed officials float December rate cut; yields expected to steer equity risk appetite.
FDA to remove black-box warnings from menopause hormone therapy, likely increasing prescriptions and impacting women’s health markets.
Studies: daily coffee linked to 39% lower AFib risk; Vitamin D3 halves recurrent MI; no clear acetaminophen–autism link.
DARPA backs new fab using 3D heterogeneous integration, advancing defense semiconductors and U.S. chip supply resilience.
China births down ~70% since 1963, intensifying demographic headwinds for growth, housing, and fiscal sustainability.
Wikipedia pushes AI firms to use paid API, signaling rising content licensing costs across generative AI supply chains.
Ripple pivots from crypto rails toward traditional finance services, seeking regulatory acceptance and diversified revenue.
